revised_title: Influence of Foreign Gases on Paraffin Decompositions and Unimolecular Reactions
tldr: The authors studied the influence of foreign gases on the thermal decomposition of paraffins. They found that certain gases, like sulfur hexafluoride and carbon tetrafluoride, increase the rate of decomposition. The results provide new insights into the current theory of unimolecular reactions and the role of foreign gases in the decomposition process.
